newsitem.title: USA: Ryder System sets 2-year stock buyback plan.
newsitem.headline: Ryder System sets 2-year stock buyback plan.

text.p: Ryder System Inc said Monday its board authorized the buyback of up to six million shares of its common stock over the next two years.
Ryder currently has 77.3 million shares of issued and outstanding common stock, the company said. The buyback represents about 7.7 percent of the tota shares outstanding.
The plan would retire capital associated with the expected sale of Ryder's automotive carriage business and fund employee stock option plans, it said.

"We expect the stock buy-back program to begin at modest levels and accelerate once the pending sale of our automotive carriage business is completed," Ryder chief M. Anthony Burns said in a statement.
